meanings.definition: A person or thing that voids something.
meanings.sent1: The voider quickly emptied the trash can.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum cleaner is a helpful voider in cleaning up messes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous voider accidentally deleted all the files on the computer.
meanings.sent4: Her absence left a voider in our team that was hard to fill.
meanings.sent5: The black hole acted as a powerful voider, sucking everything into its depths.

meanings.definition: A device used to create a void or empty space.
meanings.sent1: The voider was a small handheld tool that sucked up dust.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum cleaner is a common household voider.
meanings.sent3: The magician's voider made objects disappear into thin air.
meanings.sent4: The black hole in space is nature's ultimate voider.
meanings.sent5: The voider created a vacuum, pulling all the air out of the container.

meanings.definition: A person who nullifies or cancels something.
meanings.sent1: The voider canceled the contract at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer acted as a voider in the legal dispute.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous voider found a loophole to void the agreement.
meanings.sent4: Her swift action as a voider saved the company from a costly mistake.
meanings.sent5: The voider's decision to nullify the transaction had far-reaching consequences.
